para.text: The following elements are available in a component diagram.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

para.text: A package is a grouping of model elements. Packages themselves may be nested within other packages. A package may contain subordinate packages as well as other kinds of model elements. All kinds of UML model elements can be organized into packages.
In order to create Package in the component diagram,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Click at the position where Package will be placed in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: A package is created and the quick dialog of package appears.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: At the quick dialog, enter package name.
key. Then the package is shown as follows.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Click at the position where Interface will be placed in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: At the quick dialog, enter interface name.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: key. Then the interface is shown as follows.

para.text: A component represents a modular, deployable, and replaceable part of a system that encapsulates implementation and exposes a set of interfaces.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Click at the position where Component will be placed in the
. And at the quick dialog, enter component name and press
key. The result is as follows.

para.text: In order to add resident element to component,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: , you can add resident element by using

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: The component is assigned to component as resident component and is shown as follows.

para.text: In order to create providing relationship,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Drag from component and drop to interface in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

para.text: In order to create requiring relationship,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Drag from component and drop to interface in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Finally, the interface requiring relationship is created.

para.text: Procedure for creating providing interface of class.
In order to create providing inteface of class, use shortcut creation syntax.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Double-click class. At the quick dialog, enter "-@" staring and interface name, separate interface names by "," character.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: key. Several interfaces provided by selected class is created and arranged automatically.

para.text: Procedure for creating requiring interface of class.
In order to create requiring inteface of class, use shortcut creation syntax.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Double-click class. At the quick dialog, enter "-(" or "-->", and enter interface names, separate interface names by "," character.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: key. Several interfaces required by selected class is created and arranged automatically.

para.text: In order to create port on a component,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: And click the component where the port will be contained in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: A port is created on the component. At the quick dialog, enter the port name and press

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

para.text: Procedure for creating view by dragging port
You can create port by dragging port from

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: and drop on the component in the main diagram.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: A port appears on the component. If it is not dropped on the component but on the other area of the diagram, component with port will be created

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: And click the component where the part will be contained in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Drag from one part and drop to the other part in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: The connector between two parts is created finally as follows.

para.text: A component instance is an instance of a component that resides on a node instance. A component instance may have a state.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: And click at the position where ComponentInstance will be placed in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Enter the component instance name at the quick dialog and press
key. The result is as follows.

para.text: Procedure for adding attribute to component instance
There are two way to add AttributeLink to component instance.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: using ComponentInstance model in the main diagram or the

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

para.text: In the case of using ComponentInstance model,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: and you can add Attribute Link.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: button in slots property on properties window.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: , you can add attribute link by using

para.text: An Artifact represents a physical piece of information that is used or produced by a software development process. Examples of Artifacts include models, source files, scripts, and binary executable files. An Artifact may constitute the implementation of a deployable component.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: And click at the position where Artifact will be placed in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: The artifact is created on the diagram and the quick dialog is shown. At the quick dialog, enter the artifact name

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Drag from one associated and drop to another in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Between two elements, the association is created finally.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Drag and drop between elements in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: The dependency between two elements is created.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Drag and drop between elements in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: The realization is created as follows.

para.text: In order to create Link between two components,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Drag from one ComponentInstance and drop to the other ComponentInstance in the
. Then the link is created as follows.
